getTitle().Description: Returns the title to use for this file selector. If null a default title should be used.

Returns: an Intent that supports basic file chooser sources.
createIntent().Description: Creates an intent that would start a file picker for file selection. The Intent supports choosing files from simple file sources available on the device. Some advanced sources (for example, live media capture) may not be supported and applications wishing to support these sources or more advanced file operations should build their own Intent. How to use:

getFilenameHint().Description: The file name of a default selection if specified, or null.

Returns: the Uris of selected file(s) or null if the resultCode indicates activity canceled or any other error.
Parameters: int: the integer result code returned by the file picker activity.
Intent: the intent returned by the file picker activity.
parseResult(int,android.content.Intent).Description: Parse the result returned by the file picker activity. This method should be used with @B_android#webkit#WebChromeClient#FileChooserParams#createIntent_E@. Refer to @B_android#webkit#WebChromeClient#FileChooserParams#createIntent_E@ for how to use it.
parseResult(int,android.content.Intent).FullName: public static Uri[] parseResult (int resultCode, Intent data)

Returns: the Uris of selected file(s) or null if the resultCode indicates activity canceled or any other error.
Parameters: int: the integer result code returned by the file picker activity.
Intent: the intent returned by the file picker activity.
parseResult(int, android.content.Intent).Description: Parse the result returned by the file picker activity. This method should be used with @B_android#webkit#WebChromeClient#FileChooserParams#createIntent_E@. Refer to @B_android#webkit#WebChromeClient#FileChooserParams#createIntent_E@ for how to use it.
parseResult(int, android.content.Intent).FullName: public static Uri[] parseResult (int resultCode, Intent data)

getAcceptTypes().Description: Returns an array of acceptable MIME types. The returned MIME type could be partial such as audio/*. The array will be empty if no acceptable types are specified.

isCaptureEnabled().Description: Returns preference for a live media captured value (e.g. Camera, Microphone). True indicates capture is enabled, false disabled. Use getAcceptTypes to determine suitable capture devices.
